questions.question: DRS stands for Decision Review System.
Each team gets 2 reviews per innings in Test cricket.
Ball tracking technology is used to predict the path of the ball for LBW decisions.
A team retains its review if the decision is overturned.
Hot Spot technology detects edges by measuring heat signatures.
DRS was first used in international cricket in 2008.
The third umpire can overturn any decision without player referral.
Snickometer technology detects sound to determine if the ball hit the bat.
DRS is mandatory in all international cricket matches.
The 'Umpire's Call' margin for LBW decisions is 50% of the ball hitting the stumps.
